title: Strictly Halloween week songs and dances revealed
text:
It’s almost Halloween, and you know what that means – it’s time for the Strictly Come Dancing contestants to strut their stuff to tenuously terrifying tunes.

The songs and dances for this weekend’s Halloween special have been unveiled, and after 15 years and 17 series, we’re finally getting a routine set to the greatest Halloween song of all time.

Yep, that’s right – Everybody (Backstreet’s Back) by the Backstreet Boys is coming to Strictly.

The band themselves performed the classic banger on the results show last year, but this weekend, Chris Ramsey will get the honour of dancing to the song for the first time.

Chris and Karen will samba to the Backstreet Boys (Picture: Guy Levy/BBC/PA Wire )

The comedian and his partner Karen Hauer will perform the samba to the song in the hopes of making it through Halloween week.

We’ll vote for the song choice alone, tbh.

Michelle Visage and Giovanni Pernice are also bang on theme, dancing the foxtrot to the theme from The Addams Family, while Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse will be dancing their tango to Billie Eilish’s Bad Guy.

Fresh from the success of their Charleston, Alex Jones and Neil Jones have chosen street/commercial for their couple’s choice, which will be set to the theme from Ghostbusters.

Strictly Halloween week songs and dances Alex and Neil: Couple’s Choice (Street/Commercial) to Ghostbusters by Ray Parker Jr. Catherine and Johannes: Cha ChaCha to Scared Of The Dark by Steps Chris and Karen: Samba to Everybody (Backstreet’s Back) by Backstreet Boys Emma and Anton: Tango to Toccata and Fugue in D Minor by Bach Emma and Aljaz: Charleston to A Little Party Never Killed Nobody by Fergie feat. Q-Tip and GoonRock Karim and Amy: Paso Doble to Smalltown by Boy Bronski Beat Kelvin and Oti: Tango to Bad Guy by Billie Eilish Michelle and Giovanni: Foxtrot to the Addams Family theme by Vic Mizzy Mike and Katya: Tango to What You Waiting For by Gwen Stefani Saffron and AJ: Jive to Every Little Thing She Does Is Magic by The Police Will and Janette: Jive to Casper by Little Richard

Emma Barton and Anton Du Beke will tango to Bach’s Toccata and Fugue in D Minor (you definitely know it) and Will Bailey and Janette Manrara will dance their jive to Little Richard’s Casper.

However, there’s some rather dubious song choices in there. What’s remotely Halloween-y about Bronski Beat’s Smalltown Boy or What You Waiting For by Gwen Stefani?

Last weekend saw David James become the fourth celebrity to leave the competition, following James Cracknell, Anneka Rice and Dev Griffin.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday night on BBC One.
